Plot: Guinevere Pettigrew, a middle-aged London governess, finds herself unfairly dismissed from her job. An attempt to gain new employment catapults her into the glamorous world and dizzying social whirl of an American actress and singer, Delysia Lafosse.
Title: Miss Pettigrew Lives for a Day
Writer: David Magee (screenplay), Simon Beaufoy (screenplay), Winifred Watson (novel)
Actors: Amy Adams, David Alexander, Clare Clifford, Christina Cole
tomatoConsensus: Miss Pettigrew is a breezy period comedy carried by the strong performances of Amy Adams and Frances McDormand.
